name: The Nabataeans
startIntroPart1: Aretas, King of the Nabataeans, Friend of his People, your rule was the zenith of the Nabataean civilization as your capital, Petra was one of the largest economical hubs and cities in the world at that time. Art and culture flourished while under your rule, and the culture that has grown during your rule is still being felt till today. Can you once again strike the world in awe with your culture? Can you create an economy that can eclipse your last achievements? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Apologies, friend. But you must die!
attacked: Oh no!
defeated: You will be cursed for eternity for what you've done! You will pay!
introduction: I am Aretas IV, friend of his people.
hateHello: If I knew magic, I would've cursed you by now.
tradeRequest: Shall we trade our wealth?
uniques: [+10]% [Food] from every [Food] <in [in all cities] cities> <in [Desert] tiles>
[+40]% Production when constructing [Food] buildings [in all cities]
No Maintenance costs for improvements in [Desert] tiles

name: Khwarazm
startIntroPart1: Ala ad-Din Muhammad, the Shah of the Khwarazmian Empire. You ruled from 1200 to 1220, during which you expanded your empire across Central Asia and Persia, making it one of the most powerful in the region. However, your reign ended in disaster when you mishandled relations with the Mongols by executing their envoys. Genghis Khan swiftly annihilated the Khwarazmian Empire, forcing you to flee and die in exile, marking the rapid collapse of your once-great empire. Oh, Muhammad II, the world now calls for you. Can you fix your mistakes to restore your empire? Can you redeem yourself by expanding your great empire once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are no use to use anymore, prepare for war!
attacked: You will pay for this insolence! I will see your army burn!
defeated: No! Not again!
introduction: Call me the second Alexander as I will conquer the known world!
neutralHello:
I see the crystal raindrops fall
And the beauty of it all
Is when the sun comes shining through
To make those rainbows in my mind
When I think of you sometime
And I wanna spend some time with you.
hateHello: How dare you come in here unannounced?!
tradeRequest: Diplomacy is the meal that energizes an empire.
uniques: [+100]% unhappiness from the number of cities
Empire enters a [2]-turn Golden Age <upon gaining a [Great Merchant] unit>
[+1 Gold] from [{Road} {Trading Post}] tiles [in all cities connected to the capital]
Retain [25]% of the happiness from a luxury after the last copy has been traded away
[+2 Gold, +1 Faith] from each Trade Route

name: Ireland
declaringWar: You shall taste steel for swiping me lucky charms! May their luck be with you, because that's the only thing to save you!
attacked: How dare You! You will beg for mercy!
defeated: I have failed, but the history of Ireland will never be lost.
introduction: I am Tairrdelbach Ua Conchobair, the High King of Ireland. Who are You stranger? Is that a beginning of new, brighter future?
hateHello: You know I'm such a fool for you.
afterPeace: The bards will sing songs about this war. Yet, I am glad it is over.
tradeRequest: Here is an offer that might benefit both of us.
uniques: Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [17]% less than normal
All newly-trained [Melee] units [in all non-occupied cities] receive the [Kern] promotion

name: The Vandals
startIntroPart1: Gaiseric of the Vandal Kingdom, when Valentinian III was murdered and the next emperor cancelled the marriage between your child and theirs, you invaded Italy and commited the great act of the Sacking of Rome. You made many conquests in northern africa and turned a small germanic tribe into a large mediterranian power. Gaiseric, can you repeat your great conquests once more? Can you strike deep into the hearts of your enemies? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Ha! You're no use to us alive? You wish you had seen this coming!
attacked: I'll drink from your skull!
defeated: You have defeated me, but your people will be scattered too one day... I should know.
introduction: Ay, stranger. Have any gold for us?
neutralHello: What can I do to earn a share of your empires riches?
hateHello: That's a nice head you have on your shoulders.
tradeRequest: May I offer you this trade?
uniques: Units in cities cost no Maintenance
Empire enters golden age <upon conquering a city> <with [30]% chance>
Ignores Zone of Control <for [Settler] units> <in [{Foreign Land} {Coastal}] tiles>
All newly-trained [{Water} {Melee}] units [in all cities] receive the [Despoilers of Rome] promotion <during a Golden Age>

name: The Scarlet Estate
startIntroPart1:
Greetings, lady Remilia Scarlet, the Eternally Young Scarlet Moon, the mistress of the Scarlet Devil Mansion. Your subordinates bow to your immortal rule, and no visitor is left unswayed by your undying charisma. 
							Located at the edge of Misty Lake, it stands as a monument to Gensokyo's many mysteries. From the clock tower to the magical library, every visitor has been awestruck by its magnificent - and should I add, well maintained - splendor. Its many powerful and loyal inhabitants have always ensured the mansion's success, and under the rule of the Lady herself, will never fail in doing so.
							Oh Scarlet Moon, will you continue the prosperous grandeur of your estate? Or will you spread the mists to the world's furthest reaches, and unite all beings under the scarlet banner? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
startIntroPart2:
The Scarlet Estate, located at the edge of Misty Lake, has been around for an unknown amount of time. Its eye-catching feature is the clock tower rising up from the red rooftops. 
							Surrounding the mansion stands a brick wall, its gate being protected by the somewhat lazy yet loyal Hong Meiling. Inside the mansion you'll find the magic Library and its librarian Patchouli Knowledge, and the many corridors whose cleanliness is under the constant supervision of the Chief Maid Sakuya Izayoi. Underneath it all you'll find the mansion's little secret, Remilia's sister Flandre. You don't want to meet Flandre.
declaringWar: My staff will be there in a moment to claim what's mine. Any resistance will be dealt with.
attacked: Looks like it's going to be a fun night.
defeated: Just go away already.
introduction: Welcome to the mansion, stranger, my name is Remilia Scarlet. Cup of tea?
neutralHello: Hello there. Make yourself at home. Ask the maid if you need anything.
hateHello: So, what are you here for?
tradeRequest: Say, what do you think of this?
uniques: -[75]% Culture cost of acquiring tiles [in all cities]
New [Military] units start with [15] Experience <during We Love The King Day>
Heals [33] damage if it kills a unit <for [{Land} {Melee}] units>
[+1 Culture, +1 Science] from [Lake] tiles [in all cities]
Enemy [Wounded] units must spend [1] extra movement points when inside your territory
[-100]% Food is carried over after population increases [in all cities]

name: New Vegas
startIntroPart1: Salutations, Mr. Robert Edwin House, stalwart leader of New Vegas! With unparalleled intellect and ingenuity, you rose to power as a technological magnate in the years before the Great War - a conflict which you foresaw and extensively prepared for. Your calculations proved almost perfect, and it was thanks to your efforts that Las Vegas was spared from nuclear destruction. The chips were almost all in place to establish your beloved city and lead humanity into the future, save one very important chip – the Platinum Chip. And though you did not realize it, your centuries of planning and humanity's fate hinged entirely on one external factor you could not predict nor control – a Courier.
startIntroPart2: Mr. House, New Vegas calls for your leadership. Will you restore glory and influence as an economic powerhouse, hosting visitors from the world over? Or will you send humanity into the stars, lighting future with brilliant technology? Can you build a civilization to stand the test of time?
introduction: This meeting has been a long time coming. I am Robert Edwin House, President, CEO, and sole proprietor of the New Vegas Strip.
declaringWar: You laid the foundation for my victory, so fine – I'll permit myself some freedom in how to deal with you. I'm sure the assassins will wait for you to show up.
attacked: I haven't shown my hand – I've shown one card. I've given my enemies a single, provocative datum upon which to fixate. They have no idea what other cards I'm holding. It's a strong hand, believe me - I dealt it to myself.
defeated: May there be a hell for you... a TARTARUS... bleak, unending...
tradeRequest: I like to think that you have enough sense to make the right decision. The rewards for doing so are immense... as are the punishments for not doing so.
neutralHello: Success depends on forethought, dispassionate calculation of probabilities, accounting for every stray variable.
hateHello: Sorry to deny you a moment of primate triumph, but you'll have to go elsewhere to sound your barbaric yawp.
hateNo: If you really thought that I would agree to this, then you are even more stupid than you look.
uniques: [+100]% Culture cost of natural border growth [in all cities]
May not generate great prophet equivalents naturally
Receive free [Great Engineer] when you discover [Engineering]

name: The North Pole
startIntroPart1: 'When, what to my wondering eyes should appear, but a miniature sleigh, and eight tiny reindeer, with a little old driver, so lively and quick, I knew in a moment it must be St. Nick.' - Clement Moore
startIntroPart2: 'Maybe Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. Maybe Christmas, perhaps, means a little bit more.' - Theodore Geisel
declaringWar: The naughty must be punished! Prepare to receive your coal!
attacked: You dare declare war on Christmas? Bah humbug!
defeated: Christmas is canceled! Who will help the children now?
introduction: Merry Christmas! Have you been good this year?
neutralHello: What would you like for Christmas?
hateLetsHearIt: Go on, give me your letter.
afterPeace: Enough fighting. Time for milk and cookies.
tradeRequest: I have gifts for you!
uniques: [+1 Culture, +1 Production] from [Snow] tiles [in all cities]
Instantly provides [1] [Milk and Cookies] <upon declaring friendship>

name: The Maya
startIntroPart1: Kneel before King Pacal the Great, son of the gods and protector of the Palenque domain! After your kingdom has been harassed for years by neighboring rivals, you struck back at the enemies of your people, defeating each of them and sacrificing their leaders as a retribution to the insults made to your ancestors. Your wisdom and hard will not only restored the glory of Palenque, but turned it into a magnificient city, as your people built the greatest monuments and architecture the world has ever known.
startIntroPart2: Absolute King, your people need you to save the great Mayan culture and knowledge. Will you be able to read the movement of the stars, and find in the heavens the power to repel any foes? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: A sacrifice unlike all others must be made!
attacked: Muahahahahahaha!
defeated: Today comes a great searing pain. With you comes the path to the black storm.
introduction: Greetings, wayward one. I am known as Pacal.
tradeRequest: Friend, I believe I may have found a way to save us all! Look, look and accept my offering!
hateHello: A bad day, I hate you.
neutralHello: A fine day, it helps you.
uniques: Receive a free Great Person at the end of every [Maya Long Count calendar cycle] (every 394 years), after researching [Theology]. Each bonus person can only be chosen once.
Once The Long Count activates, the year on the world screen displays as the traditional Mayan Long Count.
[+1 Food] from [Luxury resource] tiles [in all cities] <in tiles adjacent to [City center]>

name: Ethiopia
startIntroPart1: May God bless you, wise and righteous Emperor of Ethiopia, Haile Selassie. As one of Ethiopia's greatest rulers and a spiritual leader of the Rastafarian movement, your good influence on diplomacy and political cooperation are praised throughout the world. You created Ethiopia's first written constitution, and favorized democracy for years to come, your great wisdom making Ethiopia enter as a charter member in the United Nations. Always aiming to reform and modernize your nation, you changed Ethiopian destiny for the best.
startIntroPart2: Revered King, your knowledge and intelligence are required once again to protect your people from many threats in the world. Will you secure peace and stability, with benevolence and authority, in the radiance of the Kebra Nagast? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: I have tried all other avenues, but yet you persist in this madness. I hope, for your sake, your end is swift.
attacked: It is silence that allows evil to triumph. We will not stand mute and allow you to continue on this mad quest unchecked.
defeated: God and history will remember your actions this day. I hope you are ready for your impending judgment.
introduction: A thousand welcomes to our fair nation. I am Selassie, the Ras Tafari Makonnen and Emperor of Ethiopia, your humble servant.
tradeRequest: I request that you consider this offer between our two peoples. I believe it will do us both good.
uniques: [+20]% Strength <when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than you>

name: France
startIntroPart1: Vive Napoleon I, First Consul and Emperor of France! After the glorious Revolution which suppressed the centuries-old monarchy, the French nation stood at the heart of Europe as a Republic, and intended to export its ideals to the entire European continent, either by diplomacy or war. The French Capital Paris was more than ever the world center of Culture, Arts, and Letters. With its Great Army, reputed as one of the greatest in the History, France fought gloriously all surrounding enemies, but eventually fell against the coalition of other European powers.
startIntroPart2: Napoleon Bonaparte, ruler of the French people, will you rebuild the Empire to take revenge on your foes, and make again of its Capital the City of Lights? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: You're disturbing us, prepare for war.
attacked: Honhonhonhonhon, you've fallen into my trap. I'll bury you.
defeated: I congratulate you for your victory.
introduction: Welcome. I'm Napoleon, of France; the smartest military man in world history.
hateHello: Putain, tue-toi, espèce de petit enculé mangeur de merde!
tradeRequest: France offers you this exceptional proposition.

name: Venice
startIntroPart1: Greetings, most astute Doge Enrico Dandolo of Venice, master of statecraft and shrewd negotiator. Although you rose to power late in life, old age did little to slow your cunning or ambition, as you deftly managed the bustling commercial center of Venice during a time of great instability. In aligning yourself with the Fourth Crusade, you carefully gained a strategic advantage and used the Crusaders to reacquire lost territory for Venice. Your role in guiding the Crusaders during the sacking of Constantinople led to an even greater expansion of your power, and secured your legacy throughout history.
startIntroPart2: Most insightful and cunning Doge, Venice once again requires the service of a skilled leader, one who can bring the republic back to the forefront of world affairs. Can you establish your nation through careful trade, or will you work to conquer your enemies through diplomacy? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: When you will be gone, Sir, there will be more for me!
attacked: You have revealed your purposes too early, my friend!
defeated: A wrong calculation, on my part.
introduction: Welcome to Venice. I am Doge Enrico Dandolo.
hateHello: Ah, my friend, don't look over here yet, I've got a surprise for you... now, turn around so you can get it between the eyes.
tradeRequest: This offer won't be valid for a lot of time, think about it.
uniques: Receive free [Merchant of Venice] when you discover [Optics]
Gifts of Gold to City-States generate [+50]% more Influence

name: Assyria
startIntroPart1: The people bow to your esteemed will, o wise and illustrious King Ashurbanipal of Assyria. Across the world, you are known as both a scholar and a warrior, and yet the legends represent merely a glimmer of your true ambition. Although your enemies cowered at the thought of your ferocity in conquest, you were most proud of your intellectual pursuits. Your thirst for knowledge led to your establishment of the royal library at Nineveh, which came to represent one of the greatest collections of ancient texts and tablets found anywhere in the world - securing your legacy as one of Assyria's greatest kings.
startIntroPart2: Wise and fearsome king, the time has come for you to return the kingdom of Assyria to its greatest heights. Will you once again strive to acquire the knowledge and histories of all the world's peoples? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: The wheels of Assyria's siege engines thunder forth, grinding the weak to dust beneath their wheels!
attacked: I think you will come to regret this decision...most unwise.
defeated: We may be defeated, but our legacy will live on in the written word! I spite you and your nation, may my loathing rust your iron, wilt your crops, and burn your homes to glass!
introduction: I welcome you to the great kingdom of Assyria...have you come to view my library?
neutralHello:
Ah, I'm sure you saw the walls on the way into my city. 
What did you think of my decorations?
hateHello:
MIGHTY ASHUR! SEND HIM TO HELL! 
              SEND HIM NOOWWW!
tradeRequest: Consider this offer very carefully.
uniques: Upon capturing a city, receive [5] times its [Science] production as [Science] immediately
Earn [10]% of the damage done to [Land] units as [Science]

name: The Undead
startIntroPart1: 'When there's no more room in Hell, the dead will walk the earth.' - George A. Romero
startIntroPart2: 'Darkness falls across the land, the midnight hour is close at hand, creatures crawl in search of blood to terrorize y'all's neighborhood' - Vincent Price
declaringWar: BRAINS!
attacked: Grrr!
defeated: Urk!
introduction: Brains...
tradeRequest: T-...tr-...trade?
uniques: Comment [Unable to gain Settlers or found more than one city]
[2] free [Skeleton Warrior] units appear <upon turn end>
Comment [Massive penalty in all interactions with City-States]
May buy [{Land} {Military}] units with [Faith] for [5] times their normal Production cost
Resting point for Influence with City-States is increased by [-60]
[-100]% unhappiness from the number of cities
[non-[Air]] units gain the [Breach the Walls] promotion
[Melee] units gain the [Eat the Living] promotion
[+15]% Strength <for [All] units> <when defending> <when fighting in [Graveyard] tiles>

name: Wakanda
startIntroPart1: 10,000 years ago, Wakanda was home to a collection of primitive human tribes. It was during this time a massive meteorite made of a sound and energy absorbing mineral, which would later be known as vibranium crashed to Earth. One of the tribes, led by Bashenga, its mightiest warrior, decided to investigate, believing this to be a gift from the gods. Bashenga prayed to the Panther God to give him the strength to defeat these demons, becoming the first Black Panther and uniting the tribes to form the nation of Wakanda. His lineage would later rule the country for centuries. Now you, T'Challa, are the latest to sit upon his throne.
startIntroPart2: For centuries Wakanda has remained in isolation. Now, they are considered the most technologically advanced nation of the planet. Can you uphold their mighty legacy, king T'Challa? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Wakanda forever!
attacked: It is my responsibility to make sure our people are safe and that vibranium does not fall into the hands of a person like you.
defeated: It is over for us. What happens now determines what happens to the rest of the world.
afterPeace: Our weapons will not be used to wage war on the world. It is not our way to be judge, jury, and executioner for people who are not our own.
introduction: Greetings from Wakanda. I am T'Challa, king of Africa's greatest people.
tradeRequest: We all know the truth: more connects us than separates us. But in times of crisis the wise build bridges, while the foolish build barriers. We must find a way to look after one another, as if we were one single tribe.
uniques: Unlock more secrets by building upon the Sacred Mound

name: Aztecs
startIntroPart1: O divine Montezuma, your people welcome you! May your magnificence inspire all living things! The mighty Aztecs were nomads until the 12th century, when they choose to settle in the mesa central, which would later be called Mexico. Wars were frequent with other tribes to control the rich land surrounding the sacred lakes of Texcoco, Xaltocan and Zampango. In some 200 years, double-sided alliances and martial prowess made of the Aztecs the dominant power in the Central American basin, forming a mighty empire stretching from sea to sea. Alas, the empire fell under the assault of foreign devils - the Spaniards and many curses they brought with them! Wars between tribes and weaponry of doom used by the invaders made the great Aztec civilization crumble in only a few decades.
startIntroPart2: O mighty King Montezuma, do you hear the call of your people seeking for revenge? Will you lead them to victory under the light of the Five Suns? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Xi-miqa-can! Xi-miqa-can! Xi-miqa-can! (Die, die, die!)
attacked: Excellent! Let the blood flow in raging torrents!
defeated: Monster! Who are you to destroy my greatness?
introduction: What do I see before me? Another beating heart for my sacrificial fire.
neutralHello: Welcome, future allies from across the sea. Please, stay in my palace while we discuss your people's tributary status.
hateHello:
IT IS YOU 
BLOOD FOR SEX 
YOUR BLOOD FOR SEX
tradeRequest: Accept this agreement or suffer the consequences.
uniques: [+100]% Happiness from luxury resources gifted by City-States
Militaristic City-States grant units [5] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation <when above [500] [Gold]>

name: Inca
startIntroPart1: King Pachacuti Sapa Inca, maker of the world and ruler of Tawantinsuyu and the Inca people, your loyal subjects greet you! In the beginning, the small state of Cusco already showed the Incans were promised for greatness. They won many wars against powerful enemies, relentlessly crushing any army that dared oppose them, and forged a mighty empire stretching from Ecuador to Chile, the greatest ever seen in pre-Columbian America. Not just undaunted soldiers, Inca people were accomplished builders and artists, their magnificient and unequalled culture still fascinating the world today.
startIntroPart2: O Emperor Pachacuti, honor your name of 'Earth Shaker'! Will you once again summon the power of the earth to unite all Incan people under the protection of Sapa Inca, the Son of the Sun? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Resistance is futile! You cannot hope to stand against the mighty Incan empire. If you will not surrender immediately, then prepare for war!
attacked: Declare war on me?!? You can't, because I declare war on you first!
defeated: How did you darken the sun? I ruled with diligence and mercy—see that you do so as well; or I'll come back and be million.
introduction: How are you? You stand before Pachacuti Inca Yupanqui.
neutralHello:
Castration in the sky? 
Yout penis will fly!
hateHello:
That's it. 
You are going to Acre.
tradeRequest: The Incan people offer this fair trade.
uniques: Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Hills
No Maintenance costs for improvements in [Hill] tiles
[+25]% Production when constructing [Gold] buildings [in all cities connected to capital]
[+2 Culture, +1 Food] from [Mountain] tiles [in all cities]

name: Armenia
startIntroPart1: Great Tigranes, King of Kings, you tower over the lands of Greater Armenia. IT was under your rule that Armenia's ancient dynasties would finally be put to hell and, at your command, would give rise to a powerful kingdom like no other. So great was Armenia's strenght that no army could overcome it. From Rome to Parthia, neighbouring empire trembled in fear. It is upon your example that future Armenian kings would look in both awe and envy.
startIntroPart2: Mighty Tigranes Magnus, Armenis is faced once again with great foes. These are the greatest empires of the world, and Armenia stands at their cross-roads. Can you lead the defense of your realm? Can you unite your bickering nobles to ensure Armenia remains free and strong? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are a disgrace to this world and I shall end you!
attacked: So that's how you treat others? We shall teach you a lesson.
defeated: I might perish, but my people will never forget all that suffering you have brought.
introduction: I am the great Tigranes. Welcome to the hills of Armenia. I will now leave and pray for our bright future - If you don't mind.
hateHello: Don't waste too much of my time! Just waste enough!
hateNo: No one would agree to that. Ever.
hateYes: You can't simply refuse such offer.
afterPeace: We shall now pray for the better days!
tradeRequest: My favorite customer, I bring you an excellent offer!
uniques: [Mounted] units gain the [Ignore terrain cost] promotion
[+33]% Production when constructing [Siege] units [in all cities] <during a Golden Age>
[+50]% Faith cost of generating Great Prophet equivalents
[Faith] cost of purchasing items in cities [-50]%
[+10]% Strength <for [Mounted] units> <when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than you>

name: Korea
startIntroPart1: Greetings to you, King Sejong the Great, heir of the Choson Dynasty! Prosperity and benevolence towards the common man are the principles of your reign, and made of you the most beloved Korean king. You always aimed to provide a fair and equal society for all your people, and also to favor knowledge and technological discoveries. Your wisdom and intelligence imbued all the Korean society, and the scholars of the Jade Hall developed Korea's first written language, Hangul, sharing further literature and science to the people after centuries of darkness.
startIntroPart2: Wise Sejong, will you gift your people with the radiance of harmony and knowledge to dispel the darkness once again? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Jip-hyun-jun will no longer tolerate your irksome behavior. We will liberate the citizens under your oppression even with force, and enlighten them!
attacked: Foolish, miserable wretch! You will be crushed by this country's magnificent scientific power!
defeated: Now the question is who will protect my people. A dark age has come.
introduction: Welcome to the palace of Choson, stranger. I am the learned King Sejong, who looks after his great people.
hateHello:
An uncivilized little creature, getting up to mischief, 
this is no good. 

Ugh, the beast is barbaric in nature, 
very icky, no good.
tradeRequest: We have many things to discuss and have much to benefit from each other.
uniques: [+2 Science] from every specialist [in all cities]
Receive a tech boost when scientific buildings/wonders are built in capital

name: Himyar
startIntroPart1: TBD
startIntroPart2: TBD
declaringWar: You are an obstacle and you shall be removed!
attacked: Disappointing...
defeated: You may take our lands, but you will never take our pride!
introduction: Welcome to my court. I bet the smell of our Incense got you here.
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
tradeRequest: I think that's a fair offer.
uniques: May convert Incense to Myrrh or Frankincense luxury resources
[+15]% [Gold] from Trade Routes <during a Golden Age>

name: Shoshone
startIntroPart1: Blessings be upon you, wise and fearsome Chief Pocatello, revered leader of the Shoshone people. As the young chieftain of the Shoshone, you rose to face a wave of encroaching American settlements across the western United States. Forced to defend the Shoshone ancestral lands from a seemingly endless stream of new emigrants, your war band struck fear into those who would claim the sacred lands of your people. After years of strife, you skillfully avoided a direct conflict with the armies of the U.S. government, and negotiated a series of treaties in the hopes of establishing a lasting peace for the Shoshone.
startIntroPart2: Most esteemed Pocatello, your people once again look to you for guidance. Will you conquer your enemies, driving them far from your lands? Or will you seek out peaceful diplomacy and trade? Will you build a civilization that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Shoshone!, We will kill the white man!
attacked: I must make the foreigner go away!
defeated: This will not be the end of my people, I assure you.
introduction: I am Chief Pocatello. You have arrived in the thick of Shoshone land.
tradeRequest: Would you listen to my proposal over a bottle of water?
uniques: [+15]% Strength <for [All] units> <when fighting in [Friendly Land] tiles>
[-40]% Culture cost of natural border growth [in all cities]
[-1 Food, +1 Production] from every [Plains] <when at war>

name: Israel
startIntroPart1: Great and wise Solomon, King of Israel and son of David. You were the leader of the Jewish people, ruling over a shortlived kingdom in the Promised Land, before your people would once again become wanders. Yet Babylon has fallen, Alexander ended the rules of Persians, Rome grew in power and fell, the crusaders were defeated, and still your people has survived. The Jewish people have shown the world a strenght of culture and tradition, their religion and beliefs standing strong against the many who sought to destroy them. After three thousands years, your nation has proven to be one of the most tenacious in history, carving out a place for themselves like the rain wears away at the rock.
startIntroPart2: King Solomon, the time has come to reign once again. Shall you build great temples and bring peace to your people? Will your divine wisdom carve ought an empire of art and learning? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: The Lord demands justice!
attacked: The Lord presented me your plans. We are prepared!
defeated: Is this how my peaceful reign ends? In a river of blood and suffering...
introduction: I am Solomon, King of the Chosen People. If you seek justice or advice, know that you had found them.
hateYes: The Lord told me it will be wise to accept this offer.
afterPeace: Praise the Lord as he gives peace!
tradeRequest: I present you this trade offer, it's the most you shall have of me.
uniques: [-25]% Faith cost of generating Great Prophet equivalents
[+25]% Strength decreasing with distance from the capital <when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than you> <when above [300] [Faith] (modified by game speed)>

name: Persia
startIntroPart1: Great King Darius of Persia, the heaven casts its light upon you! Persian people are strong and wise, as their leader. In old ages, the great Persian king Cyrus fought back the mighty Median empire and finally destroyed the Medes in 550 BC. Cunning diplomacy and military achievements helped then to conquer the wealthy Lydia and the powerful Babylon, Cyrus' son conquering the eternal Egypt some years later. At the height of its power, the Persian Empire reached the shores of Macedonia, at the very door of the upstart Greek city-states. Persia would have prospered for centuries if Alexander of Macedon hadn't brutally destroyed the great empire in one violent strike.
startIntroPart2: King Darius, the people of Persia await, longing for its past glory and power! Persia of the Immortals must reborn, to punish its foes and rebuild the gleaming Persepolis! Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Your continue existence is an embarrassment to all leaders everywhere! You must be destroyed!
attacked: Curse you! You are beneath me, son of a donkey driver! I will crush you!
defeated: You mongrel! Cursed be you! The world will long lament your heinous crime!
introduction: Peace be on you! I am Darius, the great and outstanding king of kings of great Persia... but I suppose you knew that.
tradeRequest: In my endless magnanimity, I am making you this offer. You agree, of course?

name: The Hittites
startIntroPart1: We bow before thee, King Mursili II, son of Suppiluliuma I, one of the most powerful rulers of the Hittite Empire! You had prove to be more than a match for your successful father, in your military deeds and diplomacy. Compared to the other great kingdoms of the Middle East, little is known of Hatti, yet its empire was one of the great powers of Mesopotamia, rivaling Babylon and Egypt in military strenght and influence. The first Hittites probably came from somewhere in the Caucasus or modern Russia, but settled in central Turkey and later in Syria, areas whose plentiful natural resources, particularly metals, would prove crucial to the power of Hatti. Early Hittite kings focused on consolidating their power in the region, but soon became more and more ambitious, opting to strike out and execute audacious raids against even mighty Babylon: it ended with great success, and the Hittites were able to undermine and destroy the ruling Amorite dynasty in Babylon.
startIntroPart2: Great Mursili II, the time has come to prepare your sword and spirit. Great opportunities, challenges and dangers are waiting for you. The new world valus not only bravery, but also wisdome. Will you show that you lack none? Will you crush your enemies under the chariot and submit your rivals under the treaty? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Prepare to be torn apart!
attacked: We would attack you anyway. You are just hastening your defeat.
defeated: You were a worthy opponent, but you have done evil in my country. My allies will eventually avenge me.
introduction: I am the mighty Mursilis. Don't get in my way and we shall live in peace.
neutralHello: Hail, welcome to the land of Hatti.
hateHello: Don't waste much of my time!
hateNo: No one would agree to that. Ever.
hateYes: You can't simply refuse such offer.
afterPeace: You should pray for this peace to last ages!
tradeRequest: Brother, I offer this to you.
uniqueText: Iron and Horses tiles yield additional 1 [Gold] and 1 [Production]. Receive +10% [Production] bonus when constructing military units.
uniques: [+10]% Production when constructing [Military] units [in all cities]
Military Units gifted from City-States start with [15] XP
Gain [8] [Science] (modified by game speed) <upon declaring a defensive pact>
Gain [8] [Science] (modified by game speed) <upon declaring friendship>
[+1 Faith] from every specialist [in annexed cities]

name: Epirus
startIntroPart1: TBD
startIntroPart2: TBD
declaringWar: There can be only one king. Prepare for battle!
attacked: I think my emissary must have been late, I already declared war on you!
defeated: You were a worthy opponent. The gods will welcome me!
introduction: Welcome to Epirus, friend. I am king Pyrrhus. Are you another expenda... I mean Ally... or perhaps a next target of my army?
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
afterPeace: Hail, great lord. This was indeed a good fight.
tradeRequest: That should do.
uniqueText: All military units have +25% more strength when attacking cities, but suffer -25% penalty when defending against cities. +25% [Production] when constructing military units in capital. Gains a free [Great General] upon researching Bronze Working and Steel

name: Scythia
startIntroPart1: TBD

declaringWar: I am afraid your reign is over!
attacked: We will sunk you in your own blood.
defeated: I must rest.
introduction: Welcome to the steppes. I am Ateas, the king of the Scythian people.
hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.
afterPeace: I hope you've learned something from our last dispute.
tradeRequest: Do you like my offer?

name: Russia
declaringWar: You've behaved yourself very badly, you know it. Now it's payback time.
attacked: You've mistaken my passion for a weakness, you'll regret about this.
defeated: We were defeated, so this makes me your prisoner. I suppose there are worse fates.
introduction: I greet you, strangler! If you are as intelligent and tactful as you are attractive, we'll get along just fine.
tradeRequest: How would you like it if I propose this kind of exchange?
uniques: [-20]% Culture cost of natural border growth [in all cities]

name: India
declaringWar: I have just received a report that large numbers of my troops have crossed your borders.
attacked: My attempts to avoid violence have failed. An eye for an eye only makes the world blind.
defeated: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
introduction: Hello, I am Mohandas Gandhi. My people call me Bapu, but please, call me friend.
tradeRequest: My friend, are you interested in this arrangement?
uniques: Unhappiness from number of Cities doubled

name: Babylon
declaringWar: The demon wants the blood of soldiers!
attacked: Oh well, I presume you know what you're doing.
defeated: It is over. Perhaps now I shall have peace, at last.
introduction: Are you real or a phantom?
neutralHello: What message hane you come to deliver?
tradeRequest: It appears that you do have a reason for existing – to make this deal with me.
uniques: Receive free [Great Scientist] when you discover [Writing]

startIntroPart1: TBD
startIntroPart2: TBD

attacked: We shall now show you the true power of Lithuania and our true gods!
defeated: Dievas, Perkunas, why do you bring the wraith of Giltine upon me?
introduction: I am Gediminas, the Grand Duke of Lithuania, by the good will of Dievas, stay out of my way and none blood shall be spilled.
hateYes: Remember, never reject a good offer.
tradeRequest: Here is an offer that might benefit both of us.

hateYes: This offer is too good to reject.

name: Macrobia
startIntroPart1: TBD

declaringWar: You have had your chance, now prepare for war!
attacked: You DARE declare war on us? We shall make you suffer!
defeated: So that is how it all ends. I've never expected to end as a slave!

hateHello: Don't waste too much of my time! Unless you are paying for my time!
hateNo: No one would agree to that. Ever.
hateYes: You can't simply refuse such offer.
afterPeace: We shall now pray for the better, I mean more profitable, days!
tradeRequest: I bring you an excellent offer!
uniqueText: Earns [Gold] for killing enemy land units
uniques: Retain [20]% of the happiness from a luxury after the last copy has been traded away

name: Sumeria
startIntroPart1: Blessings of the heaven be upon you, oh mighty Gilgamesh, the legendary god-king of the Sumer nation. The stories of your life amaze the world to this day. After your death, the gods welcomed you as one of their kind.
startIntroPart2: O great Gilgamesh, builder of the Sumer might, your people seek your guidance! Will you descend from the heavens to astonish the world with your incredible deeds once again? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: That's enough, prepare to be smashed into the dust!
attacked: You dare to attack a demigod? You will regret this sooner than you think!
defeated: Defeat. A mere mortal emerged victorious. Can't wait to see how long you will last. Even demigods aren't invicible.
introduction: I am Gilgamesh, a demigod who descended to Earth to lead the mighty city of Uruk. Let there be peace among us!
hateHello: Bitches love bitches love me bitches love bitches love bitches olivemeolivemelovemelovemelume.
hateLetsHearIt: Just speak, don't waste my time!
afterPeace: Maybe we should celebrate the end of war?
tradeRequest: I present you this trade offer.
uniqueText: All land units move twice as fast on tiles next to rivers. +2 [Science] in Capital. +1 [Faith] from flood plains. +20% Growth in the capital.
uniques: [Land] units gain the [Cradle of Civilizations] promotion
[+1 Culture] from [Flood plains] tiles [in all cities]

name: Atlantis
startIntroPart1: Greetings, Evenor. Few empires have sparked such wonder, such curiosity. As the sunken world of Atlantis. Torn and sunk by divine punishment, your people advanced beyond imagination and ruled over this world's endless seas.
startIntroPart2: There are many who wish to see your magnificence brought to life once more, lord Evenor. Can you stand the test of time and rule over the seas once more?
declaringWar: The seas have had enough of you!
attacked: The Tides foresaw this...
defeated: Moon... Where have you gone?
introduction: This is the Fluvian Council speaking. Ever try holding your breath underwater?
neutralHello: You should come for a visit. Tie these bricks to your land feet.
hateHello: You are not welcome in the sea.
tradeRequest: This was actually built underwater.
uniques: All newly-trained [Land] units [in all cities] receive the [Seaman] promotion
[+1 Science] from every specialist [in all coastal cities] <during a Golden Age>
[+1 Culture, +1 Happiness] per [2] social policies adopted <during a Golden Age>

name: Iroquois
declaringWar: You are a plague upon Mother Earth! Prepare for battle!
attacked: You evil creature! My braves will slaughter you!
defeated: You have defeated us... but our spirits will never be vanquished! We shall return!
introduction: Greetings, stranger. I am Hiawatha, speaker for the Iroquois. We seek peace with all, but we do not shrink from war.
tradeRequest: Does this trade work for you, my friend?
uniques: All units move through Forest and Jungle Tiles in friendly territory as if they have roads. These tiles can be used to establish City Connections upon researching the Wheel.
[+15]% Strength <for [Land] units> <when fighting in [Forest] tiles> <when fighting in [Friendly Land] tiles>
[+1 Production] from [Forest] tiles [in all cities connected to capital] <in [unimproved] tiles>

name: Carthage
declaringWar: Tell me, do you all know how numerous my armies, elephants and the gdadons are? No? Today, you shall find out!
attacked: Fate is against you. You earned the animosity of Carthage in your exploration. Your days are numbered.
defeated: The fates became to hate me. This is it? You wouldn't destroy us so without their help.
introduction: The Phoenicians welcome you to this most pleasant kingdom. I am Dido, the queen of Carthage and all that belongs to it.
tradeRequest: I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.
uniques: Gain a free [Harbor] [in all coastal cities]
Land units may cross [Mountain] tiles after the first [Great General] is earned
Units ending their turn on [Mountain] tiles take [50] damage
[-33]% Unhappiness from [Population] [in all coastal cities] <on foreign continents>

name: Indonesia
startIntroPart1: Honour be with you, oh great hero Gajah Mada, prime minister of Majapahit and uniter of the Indonesian archipelago. The stories of your heroism on the battlefield are bested only by the legends of your sworn oath to unite the far-flung islands of Indonesia under one banner. Serving your queen and empire with loyalty, you not only strive to fulfill your oath and conquered any who stood in your path, but you succeeded in capturing what was then the entirety of the known archipelago, the first to unite what is today modern Indonesia.
startIntroPart2: Mighty warrior Gajah Mada, your people yearn for a strong leader who can return them to prosperity! Will you set out to conquer the neighboring kingdoms, further expanding your glory of your empire? Will you build a civilization that can stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Don't mean to stand in your way, but I have to protect them!
attacked: How dare you! Really insignificant as well!
defeated: You may win, but you cannot win upon my spirit.
introduction: You came before the great warrior, Gajah Mada from Nusantara!
hateHello: Are you a male concubine, stranger?
tradeRequest: What if we make a deal, you and me?
uniques: [+1 Gold, +1 Food] from [Water resource] tiles [in all coastal cities]
uniqueText: After researching Astronomy, 3 coastal cities each provide 2 copies of unique Luxury Resources

name: Polynesia
declaringWar: The ancient fire flashing across the sky is what proclaimed that this day would come, though I had foolishly hoped for a different outcome.
attacked: It is obvious now that I misjudged you and your true intentions.
defeated: The hard-shelled crab yields, and the lion lies down to sleep. Kanaloa comes for me now.
introduction: Aloha! Greetings and blessings upon you, friend. I am Kamehameha, Great King of this strand of islands.
tradeRequest: Come, let our people feast together!
uniques: Enables embarkation for land units <starting from the [Ancient era]>
Enables [All] units to enter ocean tiles <starting from the [Ancient era]>
[20]% of excess happiness converted to [Culture] <when not at war>
All newly-trained [Water] units [in all non-occupied cities] receive the [Supply] promotion

name: Celts
declaringWar: You shall stain this land no longer with your vileness! To arms, my countrymen. We ride to war!
attacked: Traitorous man! The Celtic peoples will not stand for such wanton abuse and slander - I shall have your balls!
defeated: Vile ruler, know you have won this war in name alone. Your cities lie buried and your troops defeated. I have my own victory.
introduction: I am Boudicca, Queen of the Celts. Let no-one underestimate me!
tradeRequest: Let us join our forces together and reap the rewards.
neutralHello: God has given good to you.
hateLetsHearIt: Forward! Before I change my mind!
uniques: [+1 Faith] [in all cities] <with [1] to [6] neighboring [Forest] tiles>
[+1 Faith] [in all cities] <with [1] to [2] neighboring [unimproved] [Forest] tiles>

name: Egypt
declaringWar: You are but a pest on this Earth, prepare to be eliminated!
attacked: You are a fool who evokes pity. You have brought my hostility upon yourself and your repulsive civilization!
defeated: Strike me down and my soul will torment yours forever, you have won nothing.
introduction: Greetings, I am Ramesses the god. I am the living embodiment of Egypt, mother and father of all civilizations.
tradeRequest: Generous Egypt makes you this offer.

name: The Huns
declaringWar: I grow tired of this throne. I think I should like to have yours instead.
defeated: My people will mourn me not with tears, but with human blood.
attacked: Now what is this?! You ask me to add your riches to my great avails. The invitation is accepted.
introduction: You are in the presence of Attila, scourge of Rome. Do not let hubris be your downfall as well.
tradeRequest: This is better than you deserve, but let it not be said that I am an unfair man.
uniques: Cities are razed [3] times as fast

startIntroPart2: TBD
declaringWar: It is your time to pass the Trial of Avalanche!
attacked: How dare you disturb the peace?
defeated: It was inevitable... The fate is a wheel, remember that.
introduction: Welcome to the roof of the world, friend. You must be tired, please take a rest, we will talk later.
hateYes: I never reject a good offer.
afterPeace: Let this peace be eternal, like the peaks of Tibet!
tradeRequest: Are you interested?

name: Arabia
declaringWar: The world will be more beautiful without you. Prepare for war.
attacked: Fool! You will soon regret dearly! I swear it!
defeated: You have won, congratulations. My palace is now in your possession, and I beg that you care well for the peacock.
introduction: Welcome foreigner, I am Harun Al-Rashid, Caliph of the Arabs. Come and tell me about your empire.
tradeRequest: Come forth, let's do business.
uniques: [+2 Gold, +1 Faith] from each Trade Route
Religion naturally spreads to cities [+3] tiles away <during a Golden Age>

name: The Aucellus
startIntroPart1: Hail, Accona Casca of the Aucellus! Your father and your ancestors come in a long line of leaders who date back to the Birdtamers, those who ruled the skies on behalf of the Birds! We have lost favor in the world due to our decline compared to modern technology, but you, our glorious leader, still have a chance to prove them wrong!
startIntroPart2: Casca IV, distant descendent of the Birdtamers and successor to the assassins of Caesar, what will you decide to do with the people of the skies? Will our wings span across the globe? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I would like for you to meet the rival of my namesake. His name is Caesar
attacked: The skies shall fall on you. I hope you reconsider your actions soon.
defeated: No! Quickly, promise to me that my people will survive. Please!
introduction: Hello. Have you heard the birds chirp? I hope they speak well of you.
tradeRequest: I have a proposal.

name: The Forelle
startIntroPart1: Welcome to the council. Your seat will be on the left of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, or the 'Minister für auswärtige Angelegenheiten'. I'm aware that there's only a skeleton there. We've all been rotting in our ocean prison since Atlantis fell. Yet thanks to the council's namesake, Josephus' historical records have given us a chance to rise. A chance to not only reject the watery depths of the Atlantic but also take up land again. You hold the position of Minister of the Navy of Atlantis. You command the fish. You are the descendent of all that's left.
startIntroPart2: So, time to get busy. They may be bodies, but your fellow ministers live in the waves. Please make something that will stand the test of time, for our sakes.
declaringWar: Must you be so vain? We're uncontested on the seas!
attacked: So be it. Off to war!
defeated: There is nothing to be said. Farewell
introduction: Hello. Did you come to fish? I recommend against doing so.
tradeRequest: So, what do you think?
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Gold] from [Ocean] tiles [in all cities]
